channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.dc:creator: Mary Ward
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should call (not visit) your GP or ring the national Coronavirus Health Information Hotline on 1800 020 080.
item.title: Coronavirus updates LIVE: Scott Morrison expected to revise COVID-19 restrictions after national cabinet meeting as global cases surpass 3.7 million, Australian death toll stands at 97

item.description: Wall Street's indexes have climbed following a clutch of upbeat earnings reports led by PayPal as investors looked past more weak jobs data caused by the coronavirus-induced economic downturn.
item.title: Wall Street gains despite more weak jobs data

item.dc:creator: Chris Roots
item.description: Sydney and Melbourne racing will be on free-to-air television for the next six Saturdays with five hours of live coverage to be broadcast on Seven.
item.title: Sydney and Melbourne racing come together on Seven

item.description: Boeing has decided to go it alone rather than take a government bailout. It's a decision its executives may regret.
item.title: Flying solo: Boeing is taking a big risk walking away from a bailout

item.description: Most countries on the continent have imposed restrictions on public gatherings, international travel and curfews among other measures.
item.title: Coronavirus could kill up to 190,000 in Africa in first year if not contained: WHO

item.description: Australia’s Chief Scientist writes that he weighed up the benefits and risks of downloading the app - and now he has it on his phone.
item.title: I'm the Chief Scientist and privacy matters to me - and here's why I've got the COVIDSafe app

item.description: For the past three years prosecutors maintained that Flynn lied to the FBI in a January 2017 interview about his dealings with the Russian ambassador.
item.title: In surprise move, US Justice Department drops case against Michael Flynn

item.description: The 103-year-old Neiman Marcus became the first major US department store group to file for bankruptcy protection during the coronavirus pandemic.
item.title: Luxury brand Neiman Marcus becomes second US retail giant to file for bankruptcy

item.description: The woman was told the restaurant's dining area was closed before she opened fire and injured at least three employees, authorities said.
item.title: Woman opens fire in US McDonald’s partly closed over virus concerns: police

item.description: The document was created by the nation's top disease investigators, but scientists have since been told it "would never see the light of day".
item.title: Trump administration shelves experts' detailed guide to reopening country

item.description: A member of the military serving as one of President Donald Trump's valets has tested positive for the coronavirus, the White House said.
item.title: Trump tests negative for coronavirus after valet becomes infected

item.description: Follow our rolling coverage.
item.title: Tablet interactive: Coronavirus outbreak

item.dc:creator: Adele Ferguson
item.description: A series of internal documents, confidential minutes and emails sent by a whistleblower show serious failings at the hospital.
item.title: Tasmanian 'Ruby Princess' hospital hit by COVID-19 outbreak warned of staff, PPE shortages

item.dc:creator: Sarah Keoghan
item.description: In two cases, patients were given their test results from a Sydney hospital more than a month after being tested at the Bondi Beach drive-through clinic.
item.title: Sydney patients waited more than a month for COVID-19 results

item.dc:creator: Colin Kruger
item.description: The buy now pay later app watched user downloads dive from 5000 to 1000 a day as the coronavirus pandemic hit Australia shortly after its January launch.
item.title: CBA-backed Klarna ready for relaunch after COVID-19 setback

item.dc:creator: Sarah Danckert
item.description: After a string of collapses by Greensill's corporate clients, the group is now under pressure to dump a key Australian customer, believed to be UGL.
item.title: Client issues mounting for Greensill as COVID-19 wreaks havoc

item.dc:creator: Georgina Robinson
item.description: The new Rugby Australia chief could be leaning on old connections to repair a damaged relationship between governing body and Fox Sports.
item.title: Clarke targets old sailing buddy to rekindle a broken relationship

item.description: The National Cabinet is considering a COVID-19 mental health response and recovery plan. This is an urgent, essential discussion.
item.title: We must use this opportunity to reform mental health support

item.dc:creator: Chris Barrett
item.description: In a rare interview, the BCCI treasurer confirms India are committed to an Australian visit despite COVID-19 restrictions but says it's "difficult" to see the T20 World Cup going ahead.
item.title: We're coming: Top official says India still on for $300m tour

item.dc:creator: Alexandra Smith
item.description: NSW Transport Minister Andrew Constance will face his first punishment after his spectacular about-face.
item.title: NSW Transport Minister Andrew Constance stripped of senior role

item.dc:creator: Angus Thompson
item.description: Planning and Public Spaces Minister Rob Stokes said the sheer volume of people now exercising on narrow walkways or parklands exposed the limitations of historic urban design.
item.title: More cycleways, streets to shut, footpaths widened under NSW's COVID-19 plan

item.dc:creator: Charlotte Grieve
item.description: Chief investment officer Raphael Arndt has been promoted to the top job at the sovereign wealth fund.
item.title: Future Fund promotes Dr Raphael Arndt to CEO

item.dc:creator: Alexandra Smith
item.description: NSW Parliament will begin a gradual return to normal sitting periods from next month.
item.title: NSW MPs to return to Parliament as more sitting days planned

item.dc:creator: Sophie Aubrey
item.description: Australians sit on average for 10 hours a day, and this total is likely to have risen during the pandemic. Timely new research shows we need to move more for the sake of our mental health, too.
item.title: Feeling down? Moody? Your sitting time may be the culprit

item.description: COVID-19 has shown us - and our employers - that staff working from home can be good for their bosses, too.
item.title: What to get her for Mother's Day? Flexible work for women - and men

item.dc:creator: Cara Waters
item.description: Cleaning startup, backed by heavyweight investors Tony Gandel, Alex Waislitz and Goldman Sachs Australia boss Simon Rothery, is on the hunt for a 1,000 cleaners.
item.title: Coronavirus deep clean surge sparks recruitment drive at Whizz

item.dc:creator: Darren Gray
item.description: Listed shipbuilder's boss David Singleton says the push by Asian nations to strengthen their navies over the next decade could generate years of valuable work.
item.title: Shipbuilder Austal eyes 'dramatic growth' in Asian naval forces

item.description: The refusal by NRL players to be vaccinated against the flu in the midst of the COVID-19 pandemic smacks of tone-deaf privilege.
item.title: Shame on reckless sports stars who endanger others

item.dc:creator: Nathanael Cooper
item.description: The Living End and Australia's leading ladies of music theatre have you covered for quarantine entertainment this weekend.
item.title: Online goodies include Movember in May and Mother's Day music

item.dc:creator: Brian Yatman
item.description: Novel proposal to lift a wreck, Captain Cook Reserve, and "easy, safe, pleasant and speedy".
item.title: In the Herald: May 8, 1899

item.dc:creator: Genevieve Rota
item.description: If you're finding it hard to switch your brain off at night, a soothing voice might be just the trick.
item.title: Top 5 ASMR channels on YouTube to help you sleep

item.dc:creator: Anna Patty
item.description: New training pathways into advanced manufacturing are needed to help address Australia's looming skills shortage.
item.title: Traditional skills in trades needed for new jobs in advanced manufacturing

item.description: After the coronavirus pandemic, managers will better understand the needs of staff with family responsibilities.
item.title: Working from home is nothing new to mothers

item.description: Fifty years ago on May 8, 1970, Vietnam War Moratorium rallies were held across Australia, with 20,000 in attendance at Sydney's Town Hall.
item.title: From the Archives, 1970: Massive Vietnam War Moratorium rally in Sydney

item.dc:creator: Kylar Loussikian
item.description: ME Bank’s super fund shareholders are rightly angry. And demanding answers.
item.title: 'Bank-xiety' promo goes the way of the redraw function

item.description: The news of the day as interpreted by our talented artists, illustrators and cartoonists.
item.title: Best of cartoons, May 8, 2020

item.description: The news of the day as interpreted in the work of our award-winning cartoonists.
item.title: Today's cartoons: The illustrated news

item.dc:creator: Ben Schneiders
item.description: The revelation raises further questions over the state government’s handling of the abattoir outbreak, which is Victoria’s biggest coronavirus cluster.
item.title: Labour hire firm told of COVID-19 outbreak days before Cedar Meats

item.dc:creator: James Massola
item.description: By challenging claims that Indonesia has coronavirus under control, Jakarta Governor Aneis Baswedan has become the Andrew Cuomo of south-east Asia.
item.title: 'Not allowed to do testing': governor says Jakarta was tracking COVID-19 cases in January

item.description: With the huge upheaval, repetitive passive thinking is becoming a persistent problem for many.
item.title: Worried and stressed? Call yourself a problem solver

item.description: The finest photos from the wire agencies as chosen by our picture editors.
item.title: Best of the world in pictures

item.dc:creator: Waleed Aly
item.description: The fear that places like Italy could be a preview of our future has been replaced by a satisfaction we’re beating this. But the really tough decisions start now.
item.title: After lockdown comes the really difficult part

item.dc:creator: David Crowe
item.description: This week showed just how little it takes for the Coalition to engage in chaotic civil strife.
item.title: What virus? It's business as usual with Coalition catfights

item.dc:creator: Jocelyn Garcia
item.description: UQ is already calling it while other universities are hopeful to reopen campuses for study in semester two.
item.title: UQ plans for online study for the rest of the year

item.dc:creator: Matt Bungard
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should call (not visit) your GP or ring the national Coronavirus Health Information Hotline on 1800 020 080.
item.title: As the day unfolded: COVIDSafe downloads continue to rise, global COVID-19 cases top 3.7 million as Australian death toll stands at 97

item.dc:creator: Neha Kale
item.description: Artist and filmmaker Helen Grace reflects on her time documenting a radical women-only community.
item.title: Windows into an alternative world

item.description: Trivia and word buffs: test your knowledge with today's superquiz and Target.
item.title: Target and superquiz, Friday, May 8

item.dc:creator: Eryk Bagshaw
item.description: Australia has also secured the emphatic support of British Prime Minister Boris Johnson in its push for an independent probe into the origins of the coronavirus.
item.title: 'Blatant interference': Former Australian foreign ministers lash Wuhan dossier

item.description: Temperature checks prove all is not yet frozen.
item.title: Soliloquising in Act 3 of the pandemic

item.description: Richard Pusey's bail application will be heard in the Melbourne Magistrates Court on Monday.
